ch.epfl.alpano.gui

Interface ChannelPainter

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ChannelPainter
    ChannelPainters allow for operations on panorama. It provides all the basic mathematical operations. This class is meant to describe a component such as
    • brightness
    • hue
    • saturation
    • opacity
    • etc.
    Various default methods have been written in order to modify the value with basic mathematical operations.
    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

      default ChannelPainter cycling()
      Apply a mathematical function (xmod1) to valueAt of each pixel.

      Divides a constant to the value of the method valueAt of the ChannelPainter.

      float valueAt(int x, int y)
      Gives the value of a canal on a point with coordinate x and y.

    • Method Detail

      • valueAt

        float valueAt(int x,
              int y)
        Gives the value of a canal on a point with coordinate x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-axis coordinate.
        y - The y-axis coordinate.
        Returns:
        The float value of the canal of the point.

      • maxDistanceToNeighbors

        static ChannelPainter maxDistanceToNeighbors(Panorama p)
        Gives a new ChannelPainter which override valueAt. For each pixel, it will return the difference of distance between the point itself and the neighbor that has the highest distance. If a point is on the side of the panorama, the neighbors that are outside will have the distance equals to zero.
        Parameters:
        p - The panorama we take the informations from.
        Returns:
        A new ChannelPainter
